meanings.definition: A gratuity or tip given to a waiter or other service worker.
meanings.sent1: After a delicious meal, the customers left a generous pourboire for the waiter.
meanings.sent2: It is customary to leave a pourboire for good service at restaurants.
meanings.sent3: The waiter was overjoyed when he received a pourboire that was larger than the bill itself.
meanings.sent4: The pourboire was like a small token of appreciation for the excellent service provided.
meanings.sent5: Leaving a pourboire is a way to show gratitude for the hard work of service staff.

meanings.definition: To give a gratuity or tip to a waiter or other service worker.
meanings.sent1: Customers often pourboire the staff at the end of a meal.
meanings.sent2: Remember to pourboire the waiter for their attentive service.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to pourboire the hotel staff for their exceptional hospitality.
meanings.sent4: She would always pourboire generously to show her appreciation.
meanings.sent5: He made sure to pourboire the barista who made his favorite coffee just right.
